intro: Licaria crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved licaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in humid lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
